_header: Your mouth it sayeth me bas me bas sweet
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French(Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
YOwre mouth hit saith me bas me bas swetWhen that y yow bihold
                    this semeth me…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…But daunger stant so nygh hit may not beWhich doth me sorow
                    gret y yow bihet
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel; “me” omitted by scribe between “bas” and “swet.”
